episodeTitle: Monsters Appear! Don't Touch the Whitebeard Pirates
episodeTitleJapanese: 怪物登場！白ひげ一味には手を出すな
episodeTitleRomanized: Kaibutsu Tōjō! Shirohige Ichimi ni wa te o dasu na
description: The Straw Hat crew ventures toward Jaya seeking information about Skypiea. During salvage operations with the Masira Pirates, they encounter a massive sea turtle that threatens their ship. Meanwhile, Buggy refuses to confront Ace, who has boarded his ship, out of fear of Whitebeard's retribution.

events.title: St. Briss Falls from the Sky
events.description: A massive ship, later identified as the St. Briss from South Blue, suddenly falls from the sky near the Straw Hats. Robin deduces it's an exploration ship that has been missing for over 200 years.
events.significance: First concrete evidence of ships falling from the sky island, setting up the mystery of Skypiea's existence and the phenomenon of knock-up streams.

quotes.text: That ship must be the St. Briss, an exploration ship from the South Blue. That man has been dead for at least 200 years.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin identifying the fallen ship and its age

events.title: Masira and the Salvage Crew Arrive
events.description: Masira, the 'Salvage King,' and his crew arrive to claim salvage rights over the St. Briss. Masira introduces himself as the captain of the Masira Pirates with a bounty.
events.significance: Introduction of Masira, who will later become an ally in the Straw Hats' quest to reach Skypiea.

quotes.text: I'm Masira, Captain of the Masira Pirates! I'm the King of All Salvagers!
quotes.speaker: Masira
quotes.context: Masira's introduction to the Straw Hats

events.title: The Master's Debut
events.description: A character known as 'The Master' makes their first appearance in the series during this episode.
events.significance: Introduction of a new character who appears during the Jaya arc events.

events.title: Underwater Salvage Operation
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji dive underwater with air hoses to explore the sunken St. Briss wreckage, competing with Masira's crew for salvage.
events.significance: Demonstrates the crew's adventurous spirit and sets up the encounter with the giant sea turtle.

events.title: Giant Shadows Block the Sun
events.description: Mysterious giant shadows suddenly appear in the sky, blocking out the sun and creating darkness. The Masira Pirates are terrified by this omen. The shadows are actually cast by normal-sized people from Skypiea 10,000 meters above.
events.significance: Major foreshadowing of Skypiea's existence and one of Oda's most clever setup-payoff moments. This mystery won't be explained until the crew reaches Skypiea and Luffy's shadow is seen from below after defeating Enel.

quotes.text: What is that?! The sky just turned to night!
quotes.speaker: Masira Pirates
quotes.context: Reaction to the giant shadows blocking the sun

events.title: Giant Sea Turtle Attacks
events.description: A massive sea turtle suddenly surfaces and devours the entire St. Briss wreckage with Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji still inside. The turtle then grabs the Going Merry's air hoses and tries to pull the ship underwater.
events.significance: Creates immediate danger for the crew and demonstrates the unpredictable perils of the Grand Line.

quotes.text: The air hoses are in the monster's mouth! Luffy, Sanji, and Zoro were eaten by that thing!
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin deducing what happened to the diving crew

events.title: Escape from the Sea Turtle
events.description: The crew manages to escape from the giant sea turtle. Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji emerge safely after being swallowed.
events.significance: Shows the crew's resilience and ability to survive dangerous encounters.

events.title: Robin Obtains Eternal Pose to Jaya
events.description: Nico Robin secures an Eternal Pose pointing to Jaya from the Masira Pirates, giving the crew a way to navigate to the island.
events.significance: Provides the navigational tool needed to reach Jaya, advancing the plot toward the Skypiea arc.

events.title: Masira Boards the Going Merry
events.description: Masira briefly boards the Going Merry before the Straw Hats kick him off their ship. Despite the rough encounter, this establishes their connection.
events.significance: Sets up the later alliance between the Straw Hats and the Saruyama Alliance.

events.title: Ace Boards Buggy's Ship
events.description: Portgas D. Ace, Fire Fist and 2nd Division Commander of the Whitebeard Pirates, boards Buggy the Clown's ship. He appears to be intoxicated or asleep.
events.significance: Sets up the comedic B-plot of this episode and emphasizes Whitebeard's fearsome reputation in the pirate world.

events.title: Buggy Explains Whitebeard's Power
events.description: Buggy explains to his crew that Whitebeard is the only pirate who fought equally with Gol D. Roger and is known as the strongest man in the world. He refuses to harm Ace out of fear of Whitebeard's retribution.
events.significance: Establishes Whitebeard's legendary status and builds anticipation for his eventual appearance. Also shows the power hierarchy in the pirate world.

quotes.text: Whitebeard is the only one who tied in a fight against Gol D. Roger! He's the strongest man in the world!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy explaining why he won't harm Ace

events.title: Ace Wakes Up and Parties
events.description: Ace wakes up on Buggy's ship and immediately starts partying with Buggy's crew, showing his carefree and friendly personality.
events.significance: Demonstrates Ace's likable personality and creates a humorous contrast with Buggy's fear and tension.

quotes.text: That ship must be the St. Briss, an exploration ship from the South Blue. That man has been dead for at least 200 years.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Identifying the mysterious ship that fell from the sky

quotes.text: I'm Masira, Captain of the Masira Pirates! I'm the King of All Salvagers!
quotes.speaker: Masira
quotes.context: Introducing himself to the Straw Hats

quotes.text: Whitebeard is the only one who tied in a fight against Gol D. Roger! He's the strongest man in the world!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Explaining to his crew why they must not harm Ace

quotes.text: The air hoses are in the monster's mouth! Luffy, Sanji, and Zoro were eaten by that thing!
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Realizing the danger the trio is in

themes.description: The episode is filled with mysteries: the ship falling from the sky, the giant shadows, and the phenomenon of Skypiea itself.
themes.symbolism: The giant shadows represent the unknown reaching down from above, literally foreshadowing the sky island adventure to come.

themes.description: Buggy's fear of Whitebeard demonstrates how reputation and power structure the pirate world.
themes.symbolism: Whitebeard's name alone is enough to paralyze a veteran pirate like Buggy with fear.

themes.description: The crew continues to face unexpected phenomena and dangers as they venture deeper into the Grand Line.
themes.symbolism: The falling ship and giant sea creatures represent the constant surprises awaiting the crew.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's knowledge and analytical skills prove invaluable as she identifies the St. Briss and secures the Eternal Pose to Jaya.
keyActions: Identifies the St. Briss as a 200-year-old exploration ship
Deduces that Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji were swallowed by the sea turtle
Obtains an Eternal Pose to Jaya from the Masira Pirates
quotes: That ship must be the St. Briss, an exploration ship from the South Blue. That man has been dead for at least 200 years.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a salvage expert and pirate captain, establishing his character before becoming an ally.
keyActions: Claims salvage rights over the St. Briss
Demonstrates his profession as the 'King of Salvagers'
Briefly boards the Going Merry before being kicked off
quotes: I'm Masira, Captain of the Masira Pirates! I'm the King of All Salvagers!

characterSpotlights.development: Ace's appearance on Buggy's ship reinforces his carefree personality while his connection to Whitebeard establishes the power hierarchy.
keyActions: Causes fear in Buggy due to Whitebeard connection
Wakes up and parties with the crew

characterSpotlights.development: Buggy's cowardice in the face of Whitebeard's reputation provides humor while establishing world-building.
keyActions: Refuses to harm Ace out of fear
Reluctantly hosts Ace on his ship
quotes: Whitebeard is the only one who tied in a fight against Gol D. Roger! He's the strongest man in the world!

mangaDifferences.difference: The episode adapts portions of three different manga chapters (221, 222, and 233), combining the Straw Hats' story with the Ace-Buggy subplot.

trivia.fact: The giant shadows that block out the sun are one of the most celebrated examples of Oda's foreshadowing. They are revealed much later to be normal-sized people from Skypiea casting enormous shadows from 10,000 meters above.

The St. Briss is an exploration ship from the South Blue that disappeared 210 years before the current story. It reached Skypiea but was sentenced to 'Cloud Drifting' and eventually fell back to the sea.
Masira's name comes from an older pronunciation of the kanji for monkey (猿), which is typically pronounced 'saru' in modern Japanese.
This episode marks the first time in the anime that Whitebeard is referred to as 'the strongest man in the world', building anticipation for his eventual appearance.
